Authors:
Maria Desterro Santos, Maria E.N. Fonseca-Boiteux, Leonardo
Silva Boiteux, Paulo C�mara, Jos� Carmine Dianese
Title:
ITS-phylogeny and taxonomy of Phyllachora species on native
Myrtacae from the Brazilian Cerrado.
Abstract:
Nine Phyllachora species found on hosts belonging to the
family Myrtaceae native to the Brazilian Cerrado were described and
illustrated. We sequenced nuc rDNA internal transcribed spacer barcode
regions for representatives of seven species and conducted phylogenetic
analyses, which provided strong support for four new species that we
describe as Phyllachora cerradensis, P. ermidensis, P. furnasensis, and
P. myrciariae. Catacauma nigerrimum was recombined into P. nigerrima,
and a key to the common Phyllachora species on myrtaceous hosts from the
Brazilian Cerrado was also included.

trees.title: Phyllachora species on native Myrtacae ITS
